skillOfTheDay: Any cross (2 s.) or V cross (2 s.).
funFact: The Iron Cross, a classic strength move on rings, dates back to the early 20th century and was popularized in major competitions like the Olympics by gymnasts showcasing extreme upper-body strength.

hintText: Floor non-acrobatic skill similar to a V-Sit
funFact: The Manna, named after Japanese gymnast Yukio Endo, was first competed in the 1960s and involves pushing from an V-sit to all the way upside-down!

skillOfTheDay: Moy piked with straddle bwd to handstand.
hintText: Parallel bars underbar skill through straddle
funFact: The Tippelt, introduced by German gymnast Klaus Tippelt in the 1980s, is a challenging pommel horse move where the gymnast performs a handstand and then swings through to a seated position.

skillOfTheDay: Swing fwd. and vault bwd. strad. to hang, also with ½ t.
hintText: Horizontal bar release move over the bar
funFact: The Tkatchev, named after Soviet gymnast Alexander Tkatchev, was first competed in 1977 on the horizontal bar and involves a high-flying release where the gymnast swings over the bar and re-catches it, a groundbreaking move for dynamic releases in gymnastics.

skillOfTheDay: Swing forward, straddle cut backward, and regrasp with straight body at horizontal.
hintText: Parallel bars underbar skill similar to Tippelt
funFact: Named after U.S. gymnast Raj Bhavsar, this skill on the parallel bars involves a dynamic backward straddle cut to handstand. It gained attention in the early 2000s for its complexity.

skillOfTheDay: Any 3/3 travel in Russian type wendeswing with 720° or more turning w. two hands between pommels.
hintText: Pommel horse skill involving a combination of travelling and twisting
funFact: Name after Chinese gymnast Wu Guonian, this skill involves a 720° rotation while crossing across the pommel horse

skillOfTheDay: Any other travel fwd. in cross support to other end (3/3).
hintText: Pommel horse skill travelling from one end to another
funFact: Named after Hungarian gymnast Zoltán Magyar, this pommel horse skill involves continuous traveling circles around the horse. Magyar popularized this move in the 1970s.

skillOfTheDay: Hdspr. sw. w. ¼ t. a. salto fwd. t. w. ½ t. or Tsuk. t. w. 1/1 t.
hintText: Vault similar to Tsukahara but where you twist right off the table
funFact: Introduced by Japanese gymnast Shigeru Kasamatsu in the 1970s, this vault set a new standard for twisting vaults.
